item.title: Mary add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Passion. It lies in all of us. Sleeping... waiting... and though unwanted, unbidden, it will stir... open its jaws and howl. It speaks to us... guides us. Passion rules us all. And we obey. What other choice do we have? Passion is the source of our finest moments. The joy of love... the clarity of hatred... the ecstasy of grief. It hurts sometimes more than we can bear. If we could live without passion, maybe we'd know some kind of peace. But we would be hollow. Empty rooms, shuttered and dank. Without passion, we'd be truly dead." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Mary add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Mary add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "I dare do all that may become a man; Who dares do more, is none" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Mary add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Lord, what fools these mortals be!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Mary add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Mary add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Mary add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I would believe only in a God that knows how to dance." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Mary add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Mary add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If I can't dance to it, it's not my revolution." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Mary add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Those who dance are considered insane by those who cannot hear the music." -- George Carlin

item.title: Mary add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Mary add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Mary add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If animals could speak, the dog would be a blundering outspoken fellow; but the cat would have the rare grace of never saying a word too much." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mary add a quote by Lewis Carroll
Mary add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "The smallest feline is a masterpiece." -- Leonardo da Vinci
